sense.name: Re-create mentally or through inference
sense.examples: Police and intelligence agencies reconstructed the events of the final hours before the suicide attack. She reconstructed the trauma of her childhood while in therapy. Researcher Valteir Martins has reconstructed the sound structure of an ancestral Maku language.

sense.name: Rebuild or remodel
sense.examples: The house was reconstructed after it was hit by a bomb. We are reconstructing these rooms through the vision of our designer. Scientists have reconstructed the remains of the oldest known dinosaur. The United Nations Mission in Kosovo (UNMIK) is working to reconstruct the civilian prison system.

sense.name: Cause someone to adapt or reform socially or politically
sense.examples: Physical exercise, military drill, and industrial training within the prison tend to reconstruct the abnormal man into a normal and useful member of society.
